cation exchange reactions investigated in our work. The
electronic properties of phosphines are determined by their
-acceptor strength as they bind to metals by
-donation from the lone pair of the P atom
-back bonding from the d orbitals of the metal into their

This eﬀect is due to the decrease of the
electronic density on the phosphorus atom and increase of the
s-character of the lone electron pair.
electronegativity of the substituents on the phosphorus atom

The NCs that reacted with GaCl
and exhibit intraparticle contrast in TEM images (
indicated by black arrows), similar to the NCs that reacted
Figure S9), which is likely due to displacement of the original
organic capping ligands (dodecanethiol) with DPP during the
CE reaction. DPP is a relatively small molecule and thus poorly
suitable as a steric stabilizer. In comparison, the NCs cluster
bulky enough to provide steric stabilization. To increase the
colloidal stability of the NCs reacted with GaCl
oleylamine (OLAM) was added to the reaction mixture and a
under these milder reaction conditions, the Cu

TPP corresponds to the wurtzite crystal structure,
Interestingly, the peaks in the ED pattern are shifted to lower
values compared to those of the reference wurtzite CGS,
indicating that the product CGS NCs have a larger lattice
constant than the reference. This observation will be discussed
in more detail below. The PED pattern (
peaks, indicating that these particles have partially lost their
crystallinity during the CE procedure, which precludes a
deﬁnitive assignment of the crystal structure. The NCs reacted
